alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 01 at 10:34AM CDT until April 05 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River near Joslin affecting Whiteside, Rock Island and Henry IL Counties. .Heavy rainfall has led to rises on the Rock River. Uncertainty with how routed flow will move through the river system remains high. As such a Flood Watch has been issued. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. The threat of flooding is increasing with current crest forecast of 12.5 feet on Monday. * WHERE...Rock River near Joslin. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon to late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Water affects some summer cottages along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued by 10pm CDT this evening.
